To wspaniała informacja dla naszej gospodarki, odwrotne emocje przeżywa teraz Władimir Putin. Pieniądze na prowadzenie wojny kurczą się Rosji w oczach.

articles.summary: Kopalnie chcą więcej pieniędzy na funkcjonowanie do 2027 roku. Na Komitet Stały Rady Ministrów trafił projekt Ministerstwa Energii, który przyznaje podmiotom dodatkowe 100 mln zł. Przytłaczająca większość dotyczy spółki Restrukturyzacje Kopalń. Na liście są też kopalnia s

articles.title: Wielka Brytania znów podnosi płacę minimalną. Relatywnie to prawie jak w Polsce
articles.summary: Rząd Zjednoczonego Królestwa zdecydował się na kolejną hojną podwyżkę urzędowej płacy minimalnej. Wszystko to dzieje się w kraju o najwyższej inflacji wśród największych gospo

articles.title: Elektroniczna faktura. Będzie problem z rejestracją samochodów?
articles.summary: Od 1 lutego 2026 r. wejdzie w życie obowiązek korzystania z Krajowego Systemu e-Faktur (KSeF) dla przedsiębiorców. Zmiana ta wpłynie na proces rejestracji nowych samochodów, system nie jest przygotowany do e-faktur - informuje "Rzeczpospolita".

articles.title: Abercrombie shares soar 37% on Hollister growth, strong earnings beat
articles.summary: Abercrombie & Fitch's namesake banner is slowing down, but revenue is ramping up at Hollister, its teen-focused brand.

articles.title: Best Buy hikes sales forecast as shoppers upgrade tech, splurge on devices
articles.summary: The consumer electronics retailer said it saw tech upgrades and strong sales of computers, gaming consoles and smartphones during the fiscal third quarter.

articles.title: Dick's Sporting Goods to shutter some Foot Locker stores to protect profits
articles.summary: Dick's Sporting Goods acquired Foot Locker for $2.4 billion. To ensure the tie-up doesn't become a drag on profits, the company is shrinking its footprint.

articles.title: A third high-profile tech leader is leaving GM as part of a software-product restructuring
articles.summary: GM is combining its vehicle software engineering and global product units under one organization, led by new Chief Product Officer Sterling Anderson.

articles.title: Sellers are taking their homes off the market at the fastest pace in nearly a decade
articles.summary: Home sellers are taking their homes off the market at a fast clip, because they are sitting for more than 60 days and prices are weakening.

articles.title: Paramount, Comcast, Netflix submit bids for Warner Bros. Discovery
articles.summary: Warner Bros. Discovery recently expanded its strategic review of its business, saying it's open for a sale. First-round bids came in this week.

articles.title: Multifamily housing leads CRE bid competition in October
articles.summary: Bidder dynamics in October saw the second-highest monthly gain over the past year, according to JLL's Global Bid Intensity Index.

articles.title: Abortion pill makers brace for restrictions a year after Trump's election
articles.summary: Abortion medication access, like mifepristone, is unchanged under Trump, but FDA reviews, lawsuits and state enforcement are creating risks for drugmakers.

articles.title: Republicans push Obamacare tax credit alternatives as enrollment deadline looms
articles.summary: Republicans are proposing alternatives to Obamacare enhanced tax credits, with the enrollment deadline just three weeks away.

articles.title: 'Wicked: For Good' soars to $150 million domestic opening
articles.summary: Universal's "Wicked: For Good" tallied an estimated $150 million domestic opening during its first three days in theaters.

articles.title: 'Stakes are high.' With shutdown over, airlines predict record numbers of travelers this Thanksgiving
articles.summary: Airline executives are hoping for a smooth Thanksgiving after a rocky fall because of the government shutdown.

articles.title: Trump claims California's $20 fast-food minimum wage hurts businesses. The truth is a lot more complicated
articles.summary: The restaurant industry predicted disaster after California instituted a $20 minimum wage for fast-food workers, but data shows that hasn't happened.

articles.title: Kohl's names Michael Bender as permanent CEO after a turbulent year and sales declines
articles.summary: Kohl's has has multiple CEOs in recent years and is struggling with declining sales.

articles.title: Eli Lilly hits $1 trillion market value, a first in health care, as Novo Nordisk tumbles
articles.summary: The pharmaceutical giant Eli Lilly's stock has been riding the skyrocketing demand for its weight loss injection Zepbound and diabetes treatment Mounjaro.

articles.title: Air cargo impact from post-crash MD-11 grounding seen as 'minimal,' analysts say
articles.summary: Air cargo could be impacted by the UPS and FedEx fleet groundings ahead of the busy holiday season.

articles.title: Air traffic controllers, technicians with perfect attendance in shutdown to get $10,000 bonuses, FAA says
articles.summary: Close to 800 air traffic controllers and technicians with perfect attendance will get $10,000 bonuses, the FAA said.

articles.title: How Byron Trott became the favorite banker of Warren Buffett and America's wealthiest families
articles.summary: Byron Trott has helped many of America's largest family-led companies grow from cash-starved startups to financial titans.

articles.title: The senior population is booming. Caregiving is struggling to keep up
articles.summary: The senior population in the U.S. is skyrocketing, but low wages and the difficulty of the caregiver job are fueling a widening shortage in the labor force.
